div.style: position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; background: #FFFFFF;

div.span: School Closure

All Vestal Schools are CLOSED through May 15, 2020, in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) by an order from Governor Cuomo issued April 16, 2020. CSE/504 meetings will be held via Zoom beginning April 27 during this period of school closure.

a.span: Please click here to visit our COVID-19 & Vestal Home Learning Resources web page

div.span: Coronavirus Updates & Vestal Home Learning Resources
Click "Read More" for COVID-19 Updates & Vestal Home Learning Resources

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_textwindow col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: Over the last several weeks, we have

populated this page with Home Learning lessons for students in Grades K - 12. Secondary resources will be updated regularly by VMS and VHS principals, and secondary teachers are reaching out to students through Google classroom. Thank you all for your understanding through this situation. Our thoughts are with our students, staff and their families. We hope you all will stay well!
For technical support, including Chromebooks and email, please call the BOCES Service Now Helpline at 607-766-3800, or click the link below.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'School Closure Technology Support for Students & Families');

div.a: School Closure Technology Support for Students & Families

div.span: This page gives families information and assistance on how to utilize MyApps, Google, Schoology and other remote learning tools while students attend school remotely.
Students can access their files and folders from home via this link. Please enter full email address for User Name and then password to log in.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: April 27, 2020
April 20, 2020

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Strategies for Coping, Calming & Talking to Kids');

div.a: Strategies for Coping, Calming & Talking to Kids

div.span: Help your children cope with this unexpected disruption in their schedules.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: While your children are home, it's just as important to support their "occupational" skills as well. Here are some ideas from our Occupational Therapists.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: Due to the number of resources available, we have migrated Elementary Home Learning resources to its own page. Please click the link above to access.

div.a: For Review: Resources from previous weeks

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
component_container clearfix component_container_textwindow col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
div.h3: Vestal High School Continuity of Learning

div.span: Teachers will communicate directly with students in their courses, and the primary contact will be via school email to provide information about continuity of learning during the school closure. The platforms vary from course to course, and may include any linked below. Students should check their school email regularly for updates. A link to student email is also included below. Finally, if you need help, please click the VHS Student Online Learning Support link.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: Units of study in some courses will be assigned through an online learning platform called Edgenuity. Please check your student email and other platforms for additional guidance about Edgenuity. Your student username is your FULL Vestal email address. Click “Forgot Password” on the Login page to receive a self-reset password to your school email. If you still need help, complete the VHS Student Online Learning Support Request form, linked below.
IB Courses only

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: Time for a break? Visit this page of resources to videos, live web cams and virtual tours of gardens, parks, museums, zoos and more!

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: In an effort to provide our families with a variety of reputable home learning options, please see the WSKG Learn at Home page with digital learning resources, distance learning tips, PBS Kids learning apps, PBS Kids for Parents newsletters and more.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_downloads col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
component_container clearfix component_container_downloads col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: By Governor Cuomo's order, schools are now closed until May 15, 2020. Here are a list of distribution locations in Broome County where students ages 18 and younger can receive multiple "grab & go" meals.
If you qualify, the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program can help buy healthy food for you and your family when money is tight.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_links col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.span: District buildings were closed to the public effective March 23. If you need assistance, please click the link above to access a list of Building/Dept. emails to contact the appropriate resource.

div.class: component_container clearfix component_container_textwindow col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

img.title: A blue cloud-shaped bubble with white text that reads Free WiFi available.
img.alt: A blue cloud-shaped bubble with white text that reads Free WiFi available.

span.span: Charter Communications will offer free Spectrum Broadband and WiFi to new K - 12 and College Student Households for 60 days, if they do not already have a Spectrum subscription. These are for students whose schools have closed due to COVID-19. For more information or to sign up, please call 855-243-8892.
